channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Potholes and road drain blocked causing flooding, 2nd December
item.description:
Between 371 and 373 Old Farm Avenue, flooding has occurred regularly for the past couple of weeks. Also existing potholes have become larger due to flooding

item.title: Trip Hazard, 2nd December
item.description:
Cracked broken, rocking paving outside H&H Property Management, 246 Bexley Rd, DA8 3HB. The worst part goes up and down by at least 25mm. I have already tripped over it once. I spoke to the people in H&H property management and they said it was Bexley Council responsibility.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bexley Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked road drain, 2nd December
item.description:
I have reported this drain in the road outside 94 Belvedere Road for several years! A contractor comes out and seems to clear the immediate blockage but clearly the blockage is further along the pipe work. The road and the pavement regularly floods and presents a danger to vehicles and pedestrians.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 90, Belvedere Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 29 Mill Lane, 2nd December
item.description:
Unsure as to whether image has loaded properly, and if it has, apologies it is blurry. The hedge within 29 Mill Lane needs pruning/trimming, as it is causing an obstruction on the pavement for pedestrians trying to pass. If the image hasn't uploaded I can try again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Mill Lane, West Hampstead, Greater London

item.title: Advertising A-board attached to lamp post, 2nd December
item.description:
A company has attached an A-board to a lamp post using a bike lock. This a-board has been there for a year or two and hasn't been removed. It's a foot path obstruction.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Norman Road, Greenwich

item.title: From West End Lane to West Hampstead Station, 2nd December
item.description:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally report the ongoing disruption caused by the street works taking place from West End Lane to West Hampstead Station. It has now been over a month since these works began, and the traffic situation has become unacceptable. Every single day, the congestion in this area results in delays of 30 minutes or more, creating a constant traffic jam from early morning onwards. I travel to work by bus through this route, and due to these ongoing delays, I am consistently arriving late. This has now begun to affect my employment, as I am facing salary deductions through no fault of my own. I fully understand that roadworks are sometimes necessary, but the lack of proper traffic management, alternative routing, or timely completion is causing serious disruption to residents, commuters, and workers. The situation has gone on long enough and needs urgent attention. I kindly request that you investigate this matter as soon as possible and take appropriate action to reduce the delays, improve traffic flow, or provide a clear timeline for when this work will be completed. The current situation is simply not sustainable. Thank you for your attention. I look forward to seeing immediate improvements.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 152, West End Lane, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
